com.flowpowered.react.collision.narrowphase.GJK

Class Simplex

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.react.collision.narrowphase.GJK.Simplex

  • public class Simplex
extends Object
    Represents a simplex which is a set of 3D points. This class is used in the GJK algorithm. This implementation is based on the implementation discussed in the book "Collision Detection in 3D Environments". This class implements the Johnson's algorithm for computing the point of a simplex that is closest to the origin and the smallest simplex needed to represent that closest point.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(Vector3 point,
                     Vector3 suppPointA,
                     Vector3 suppPointB)
        Adds a new support point of (A-B) in the simplex.
        Parameters:
        point - The support point of object (A-B) => point = suppPointA - suppPointB
        suppPointA - The support point of object A in a direction -v
        suppPointB - The support point of object B in a direction v

      • isPointInSimplex

        public boolean isPointInSimplex(Vector3 point)
        Returns true if the point is in the simplex, false if not.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to verify for presence
        Returns:
        Whether or not the point was found in the simplex

      • getSimplex

        public int getSimplex(Vector3[] suppPointsA,
                      Vector3[] suppPointsB,
                      Vector3[] points)
        Gets the points of the simplex. These will be stored in the arrays. The returned integer is the number of vertices.
        Parameters:
        suppPointsA - The support points of object A in a direction -v
        suppPointsB - The support points of object B in a direction v
        points - The support points of object (A-B) => point = suppPointA - suppPointB
        Returns:
        The number of vertices

      • isAffinelyDependent

        public boolean isAffinelyDependent()
        Returns true if the set is affinely dependent. A set if affinely dependent if a point of the set is an affine combination of other points in the set.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the set is affinely dependent

      • computeClosestPointsOfAAndB

        public void computeClosestPointsOfAAndB(Vector3 pA,
                                        Vector3 pB)
        Computes the closest points "pA" and "pB" of objects A and B.
        Parameters:
        pA - sum(lambda_i * a_i), where "a_i" is the support point of object A, with lambda_i = deltaX_i / deltaX
        pB - sum(lambda_i * b_i), where "b_i" is the support point of object B, with lambda_i = deltaX_i / deltaX

      • computeClosestPoint

        public boolean computeClosestPoint(Vector3 v)
        Compute the closest point "v" to the origin of the current simplex. This method executes the Johnson's algorithm for computing the point "v" of a simplex that is the closest to the origin. The method returns true if a closest point has been found, false if not. The closest point is store in the passed vector, if found.
        Parameters:
        v - The vector in which to store the closest point
        Returns:
        Whether or not the closest point has been found

      • backupClosestPointInSimplex

        public void backupClosestPointInSimplex(Vector3 v)
        Backups the closest point to the passed vector.
        Parameters:
        v - The vector in which to store the closest point
